item.title: Indoor Air Pollution: Final Project
item.description: Description of the DATA you used (either given to you or where you found it, what unique characteristics of the data, what quantitative and qualitative information is in the data set, etc.) Description of the AUDIENCE you are aiming for (including more detail than simply saying “a biochemist”). Description of the TYPE of graph (e.g. Bar chart, Sankey Dendogram, etc). Representation Description: What are you trying to show? How to read it & what to look for: How should a newbie to this graph approach interpreting it?

item.title: Maps
item.description: Here we will take a look at our data: trees_raw <- read.csv(here::here("data", "Parks_Tree_Inventory.csv")) glimpse(trees_raw) ## Rows: 25,534 ## Columns: 41 ## $ X <dbl> -13658194, -13658213, -13658254, -13658227,… ## $ Y <dbl> 5712487, 5712485, 5712491, 5712487, 5712488… ## $ OBJECTID <int> 426, 427, 428, 429, 430, 431, 432, 433, 434… ## $ Inventory_Date <chr> "2017/05/09 00:00:00+00", "2017/05/09 00:00… ## $ Species <chr> "PSME", "PSME", "CRLA", "QURU", "PSME", "PS… ## $ DBH <dbl> 37.

item.title: Tables and Fonts
item.description: Lab 5 - Tables & Fonts Tables Note that the pnwflights14 package includes several other data sets that may be of use and/or interest: mappings from two-letter airline codes to airline names, weather conditions, etc. data("flights", package = "pnwflights14") data("weather", package = "pnwflights14") data("airports", package = "pnwflights14") data("airlines", package = "pnwflights14") Question 1 Which airlines had the best and worst track records of on-time departures in each month? Is it different between PDX and SEA?

item.title: MoMA
item.description: Workflow for Lab 02 The lab instructions can be found here; we will work through its contents together via Webex. You will use this RMarkdown file as your workspace and final document. Don’t forget to update the “author” metadata field at the top of the file! Start by Loading Libraries moma <- read_csv(here::here("data","artworks-cleaned.csv")) ## Rows: 2253 Columns: 23 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (6): title, artist, artist_bio, artist_gender, classification, department ## dbl (10): artist_birth_year, artist_death_year, num_artists, n_female_artist.

item.title: Hot Dog Plot: Visualization Brief
item.description: 1) Description This is a bar plot showing the number of hot dogs eaten per year by the winner of Nathan’s Hot Dog Eating Contest. Additionally, information about the establishment of the IOFCE (Major League Eating) and its potential effect on the results of the contest are included. Female participants were included from 2011 and are shown in an overlay. 2) Description of the data ## Rows: 49 Columns: 5 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (3): gender, name, affiliated ## dbl (2): year, num_eaten ## ## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
